title: Compleeting Installation
content:
Mozella listed email support-seamonkey@lists.mozilla.org, Failed so here it is: OK! I've been using Mozella from your inception over 29 years. Now you and others are forcing me to convert to Firefox and Thunderbird.

Thunderbird is only 50% as good as the SeaMonkey Browser and Email, but usable if I can "cut and past addresses" from in SeaMonkey browser. I have prepared all the Exports and inports from SeaMonkey.

I have installed Firefox and filled in all of its Profile, Account, settings and Email Communications. Firefox gives me NO usable instructions for importing and of the referenced exports!!!! What little Firefox found in Thunderbird are NOT anywhere near COMPLETE!! Several needed items disappeared!

At least SeaMonkey publishes DETAILED instructions for preparing both the Export and Import items.

Firefox has no listing "PREFERENCES" section! Thunderbird has no Composer or Advance sections and details.

Under Firefox/Applications/mailto Indicates: "SeaMonkey (Default). Does this mean I must have SeaMonkey installed as well or can I change that to Thunderbird?

Firefox HELP is no help at all

NOTE: I have been using SeaMonkey by all 5 or 6 names for personal use and 23 years for my Police Department work. NOTE: I have tried to reach Mozella several times by USPS to the address listed in SeaMonkey and addresses in your local Phone Book. All were returned Marked as wrong address and phone as no longer in service.

I would greatly appreciate you sending me detailed directions to finally get things working so I can get both computers running properly and upgraded to Windows 10.

Respectfully; Vern H. Goding Loyal and Faithful User 648 Acacia Avenue Melbourne Village, Florida 32904
creator: evidtech

title: Crashing and Not Responding
content: Dear Firefox, I'm writing to express my dissatisfaction with your software's recent repeated crashes and failures on my Mac after installing Kaspersky. Before this, the app was performing properly. I'm not sure if the problem is related to Kaspersky. Please address this matter as quickly as possible.

title: Mozilla Password
content:
My computer died, I purchased a new one. I can't remember the password for mozilla. I reset it and everything is gone, bookmarks passwords, all of it. Is there a way to get any of it back?

If not, why not? Why wouldn't there be a phone number to verify ID and reset the password? Why wouldn't there be another option besides zeroing everything out? There has to be a better process than this.

title: extension on toolbar
content:
I use an extension called new xkit (for tumblr) from here: https://github.com/new-xkit/XKit/wiki/Installing-XKit#firefox (not the one listed in your extensions search, not the same).

The icon for this no longer shows up by itself on my toolbar--but under the puzzle piece.

This means that I can NO LONGER MODIFY ANYTHING in the extension. I need to have it on the toolbar, so that I can modify it--and I'm not talking about manage extensions.

UBlock origin still shows up there because you need to be able to adjust it. Same thing with New xkit. You've actually broken the extension because it's not working on tumblr anymore.

This needs to be fixed.
creator: slashgirl

title: print.always_print_silent results in printing gibberish
content: Hi, I am using firefox for my POS system(odoo) and have turned on the kiosk mode. I basically want it to print receipts without it showing me the print dialogue so I configured the option print.always_print_silent to true. However, it results that now my printer doesn't correctly print the receipt and instead prints a bunch of random string characters. It is an 80mm fairly generic printer which I have got configured and working in CUPS. Printing with the print dialogue results in a normal print. I wonder what I am doing wrong here and if someone can assist me with it. Thanks ;)
creator: abdulee

title: WidevineCdm crash on Ubuntu 22.04
content: I am using Ubuntu Firefox 110.0 (64-bit) on Ubuntu 22.04 x86_64. I am unable to play contents on Disney+, Amazon Prime Video Netflix and such. I was streaming fine until a few months ago. I have checked my settings and they are all properly set. At the time I am writing this report, the Widevine Content Decryption Module is at Version 4.10.2557.0, updated to its latest release. Obviously DRM content is enabled in settings. Changing the useragent did not solve the problem. I have seen this problem reported before for MacOs users but I could not find anything for linux users. Am I the only one having this problem? I hope someone can help. Thanks
creator: andrea.tesoniero

title: Addon icons have disappeared!
content:
There used to be icons for the few addons I use like AdBlock Utlimate. Now with Firefox 109.0 in OpenMandriva Linux v. 23.90 and 23.01 or with Firefox 109.0.1 tar.bz2 from Mozilla website they are gone. Problem occurs with Ublock Origin and the DeepL Multi-translate addon also. (I use AdBlock Ultimate or Ublock Origin, not both at same time.)

I do not know if this is something in Firefox or something in OpenMandriva Linux but would like to find out soon if possible.

The only work around I have is to use an old profile. My best guess is that profile may be from time of v. 103-104 or there about.
creator: benbullard79
